simplesect.para: The transition matrices, senone scores, and senone sequence mapping are all assumed to be allocated externally, and will NOT be freed by this function.

memberdef.argsstring: (hmm_context_t *ctx, hmm_t *hmm, int mpx, int ssid, int tmatid)
memberdef.name: hmm_init

briefdescription.para: Populate a previously-allocated HMM structure, allocating internal data.
Free an HMM structure, releasing internal data (but not the HMM structure itself).
For debugging, dump the whole HMM out.
Reset the scores of the HMM.
Reset the states of the HMM to the invalid condition.

detaileddescription.para: i.e., scores to WORST_SCORE and hist to undefined.

memberdef.argsstring: (hmm_t *h, int32 score, int32 histid, int frame)
memberdef.name: hmm_enter

briefdescription.para: Enter an HMM with the given path score and history ID.
Renormalize the scores in this HMM based on the given best score.

simplesect.para: If this module were being used for tracking state segmentations, the dummy, non-emitting exit state would have to be updated separately. In the Viterbi DP diagram, transitions to the exit state occur from the current time; they are vertical transitions. Hence they should be made only after the history has been logged for the emitting states. But we're not bothered with state segmentations, for now. So, we update the exit state as well.

briefdescription.para: Like hmm_vit_eval, but dump HMM state and relevant senscr to fp first, for debugging;.
